PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a peak in the Canadian Rockies located 18 km southwest of the Saskatchewan River Crossing in Banff National Park.
was named by James Hector in 1859 after Edward Forbes, Hector's natural history professor at the University of Edinburgh during the mid-nineteenth century.
was first ascended in 1902 by J. Norman Collie, James Outram, Hugh E.M. Stutfield, George M. Weed, Herman Woolley, guided by Christian Kaufmann.
